psalm.text:
[[Ps 40,2]]I have waited, waited for the LORD, 
and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.
[[Ps 40,5]]Blessed the man who makes the LORD his trust;
who turns not to idolatry
or to those who stray after falsehood.

[[Ps 40,7]]Sacrifice or oblation you wished not, 
but ears open to obedience you gave me. 
Burnt offerings or sin-offerings you sought not;
[[Ps 40,8a]]then said I, “Behold I come.”

[[Ps 40,8b]]“In the written scroll it is prescribed for me,
[[Ps 40,9]]To do your will, O my God, is my delight, 
and your law is within my heart!”

[[Ps 40,10]]I announced your justice in the vast assembly; 
I did not restrain my lips, as you, O LORD, know.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Mc 1,29]]On leaving the synagogue Jesus entered the house of Simon and Andrew with James and John.
[[Mc 1,30]]Simon's mother-in-law lay sick with a fever. They immediately told him about her.
[[Mc 1,31]]He approached, grasped her hand, and helped her up. Then the fever left her and she waited on them.
[[Mc 1,32]]When it was evening, after sunset, they brought to him all who were ill or possessed by demons.
[[Mc 1,33]]The whole town was gathered at the door.
[[Mc 1,34]]He cured many who were sick with various diseases, and he drove out many demons, not permitting them to speak because they knew him.
[[Mc 1,35]]Rising very early before dawn, he left and went off to a deserted place, where he prayed.
[[Mc 1,36]]Simon and those who were with him pursued him
[[Mc 1,37]]and on finding him said, "Everyone is looking for you."
[[Mc 1,38]]He told them, "Let us go on to the nearby villages that I may preach there also. For this purpose have I come."
[[Mc 1,39]]So he went into their synagogues, preaching and driving out demons throughout the whole of Galilee.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark

first_reading.text:
[[1_S 3,1]]During the time young Samuel was minister to the LORD under Eli, a revelation of the LORD was uncommon and vision infrequent.
[[1_S 3,2]]One day Eli was asleep in his usual place. His eyes had lately grown so weak that he could not see.
[[1_S 3,3]]The lamp of God was not yet extinguished, and Samuel was sleeping in the temple of the LORD where the ark of God was.
[[1_S 3,4]]The LORD called to Samuel, who answered, "Here I am."
[[1_S 3,5]]He ran to Eli and said, "Here I am. You called me." "I did not call you," Eli said. "Go back to sleep." So he went back to sleep.
[[1_S 3,6]]Again the LORD called Samuel, who rose and went to Eli. "Here I am," he said. "You called me." But he answered, "I did not call you, my son. Go back to sleep."
[[1_S 3,7]]At that time Samuel was not familiar with the LORD, because the LORD had not revealed anything to him as yet.
[[1_S 3,8]]The LORD called Samuel again, for the third time. Getting up and going to Eli, he said, "Here I am. You called me." Then Eli understood that the LORD was calling the youth.
[[1_S 3,9]]So he said to Samuel, "Go to sleep, and if you are called, reply, 'Speak, LORD, for your servant is listening.'" When Samuel went to sleep in his place,
[[1_S 3,10]]the LORD came and revealed his presence, calling out as before, "Samuel, Samuel!" Samuel answered, "Speak, for your servant is listening."
[[1_S 3,19]]Samuel grew up, and the LORD was with him, not permitting any word of his to be without effect.
[[1_S 3,20]]Thus all Israel from Dan to Beer-sheba came to know that Samuel was an accredited prophet of the LORD.
first_reading.title: 1st book of Samuel
